body_content.explanation: to stay with a series of different friends or relatives, sleeping somewhere temporary such as a sofa, because you do not have your own place to live:
examples: She fought with her mother and frequently ran away or couch surfed, camping at the homes of friends.
These unaccompanied youths may be couchsurfing or living out in the woods.
They're going to Seattle where they plan to couch-surf with friends until they find jobs.

body_content.explanation: to travel around and stay with people you do not know, who advertise their homes on the internet:
examples: He sent an email from Vietnam, where he is currently couch surfing.
My housemate and I plan to spend 3 months travelling around Europe, where we will either be staying at friends' places or couchsurfing.
